summary: The Zuni Indian Tribe Water Rights Settlement Act of 2025 aims to resolve water rights claims of the Zuni Tribe in New Mexico, protect the Zuni Salt Lake, and authorize federal funding for the agreement. It ratifies a settlement agreement, defines tribal water rights and related terms, establishes a trust fund, and outlines land management practices within the Zuni Salt Lake and Sanctuary, including withdrawals and transfers of federal land. The bill also includes provisions for environmental compliance and addresses the rights of allottees.
